cards.task: Open a file called 'script.js' in the nano text editor
cards.description: Opens a file in nano, a simple terminal-based text editor
cards.whenToUse: When you need to edit a file directly in the terminal
scenarios: You want to quickly edit a config file
You're creating a new script file
You need to make a small change without opening a full IDE

cards.task: In nano: Save the current file
cards.description: Writes (saves) the current file in nano (then press Enter to confirm)
cards.whenToUse: When you want to save your changes in nano
scenarios: You've finished editing and want to save
You want to save before making more risky changes
You're saving periodically to avoid losing work

cards.description: Exits nano (will prompt to save if there are unsaved changes)
cards.whenToUse: When you're done editing and want to close nano
scenarios: You've finished editing a file
You want to quit without saving (press N when prompted)
You're done and ready to run other commands

cards.task: In nano: Cut the current line
cards.description: Cuts (removes) the entire current line and stores it for pasting
cards.whenToUse: When you want to delete or move a line of text
scenarios: You want to delete a line of code
You're moving a line to a different location
You need to remove multiple lines quickly

cards.task: In nano: Paste the cut text
cards.description: Pastes (uncuts) the previously cut text at the cursor position
cards.whenToUse: When you want to paste text you previously cut
scenarios: You're moving a line to a new location
You want to duplicate a line (cut, paste, paste)
You need to restore a line you accidentally cut

cards.description: Opens the search prompt to find text in the file
cards.whenToUse: When you need to find specific text in the file
scenarios: You're looking for a function definition
You want to find all occurrences of a variable
You need to jump to a specific section

cards.description: Shows the help screen with all available keyboard shortcuts
cards.whenToUse: When you forget a command or want to learn more shortcuts
scenarios: You're new to nano and need guidance
You forgot how to do something specific
You want to discover more advanced features

cards.task: In nano: Go to a specific line number
cards.description: Opens a prompt to jump to a specific line number
cards.whenToUse: When you need to navigate to a specific line in a large file
scenarios: An error message tells you the problem is on line 42
You want to jump to a line you noted earlier
You're reviewing code at a specific location
